response.original_title: The Cleveland Orchestra Violins of Hope Concert
response.overview: Playing instruments recovered and restored from the Holocaust, the orchestra and director Franz Welser-Most reawakened the spirits of that tragedy's millions of victims in the most eloquent fashion possible, through music. Beyond that, they demonstrated irrefutably that art always trumps hatred and violence. | Playing instruments recovered and restored from the Holocaust, the orchestra and director Franz Welser-Most reawakened the spirits of that tragedy's millions of victims in the most eloquent fashion possible, through music. Beyond that, they demonstrated irrefutably that art always trumps hatred and violence.
response.tagline: Playing instruments recovered and restored from the Holocaust
response.title: The Cleveland Orchestra Violins of Hope Concert
